mechanism.description: Eimer's organs (more than 25,000 minute sensory receptors in touch organs)

evidence.note: From provided context. The moles are also able to smell underwater, accomplished by exhaling air bubbles onto objects or scent trails and then inhaling the bubbles to carry scents back through the nose.

evidence.note: From provided context. C. cristata is particularly adept at thermoregulation, maintaining a high body temperature in a wide range of external conditions relative to other Talpid moles. This explains its ability to thrive in cold aquatic environments.
